summary: This is an email chain from August 2020 regarding the Office of Professional Responsibility (OPR) draft report on the handling of the Jeffrey Epstein matter by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of Florida in 2006-2008. The correspondence involves a request for technical assistance to make the large, attached report searchable.

events.title: Handling of Epstein Matter by SD Florida
events.description: The period during which the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of Florida handled the Jeffrey Epstein case, which is the subject of the OPR's draft report.

events.title: OPR Draft Report Transmitted
events.description: The Office of Professional Responsibility transmits its draft report on the handling of the Epstein matter to the Acting United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York.

locations: U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of Florida
950 Pennsylvania Avenue, NAV â€” Room 3266 Washington, D.C. 20530
keyFacts: The Office of Professional Responsibility (OPR) produced a draft report concerning the handling of the Jeffrey Epstein case by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of Florida from 2006 to 2008.
The draft report was transmitted to the Acting United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York on August 6, 2020.
The attached OPR report was over 380 pages long and initially not searchable, prompting a request for technical conversion assistance on August 7, 2020.
The correspondence indicates an internal review process within the Department of Justice regarding the professional conduct of prosecutors in the earlier Epstein case.
All specific sender and recipient names in the email chain are redacted, indicated by placeholders like (USANYS) and (OPR).
